title: How to Put Your Nintendo DSi Sd Card Photos Into Your PC

steps.headline: Turn your DSi off.
steps.description: Skip this step if you already have it turned off.

steps.headline: Take out the SD card.
steps.description: Open the door on the side of the DSi, and press against the card to eject it.

steps.headline: Place the card into your SD card reader.
After a little while, you should see it as an external drive somewhere on your computer.
steps.description: On a PC, navigate to My Computer, and it should appear. On a Mac, it should pop up on your desktop.

steps.headline: Make a new folder on your computer.
steps.description: This is for you to move your photos to.

steps.headline: Open the SD card in a new window.
Navigate through the (sometimes many) folder(s) there are to find the images you want.
Copy the images to the folder you made in Step 5.

text: Turn your DSi off. Skip this step if you already have it turned off. Take out the SD card. Open the door on the side of the DSi, and press against the card to eject it. Place the card into your SD card reader.  After a little while, you should see it as an external drive somewhere on your computer. On a PC, navigate to My Computer, and it should appear. On a Mac, it should pop up on your desktop. Make a new folder on your computer. This is for you to move your photos to. Open the SD card in a new window.  Go to DCIM. The is the weird "photos" folder. Navigate through the (sometimes many) folder(s) there are to find the images you want.  Copy the images to the folder you made in Step 5.
